result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carissa Marie Livingston

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:07 AM Defendant Carissa Marie Livingston appeared by phone.  Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder appeared by video for Carissa Marie Livingston.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Cases 22CF148 & 22CF125.  Atty, prelim is waived.  Def waiving the right to a prelim hearing, understands giving up rights.  Court is satisfied and accepts the waiver.  Atty is satisfied.  Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and finds PC that a felony was committed in Ashland County.  Case is bound over for arraignment.  Atty, received criminal complaint and waives reading, pleads NG, noted.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:10 AM Defendant Carissa Marie Livingston in court.  Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder appeared by video for Carissa Marie Livingston.  Attorney David Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF125 and 22CF148.  Atty recv'd complaint, waives reading.  Waives time limits for prelim hearing, def agrees.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  22CF148 attorney is aware of case but not appointed yet, scheduled for an initial appearance today, Atty is county appointed, def asking to have attorney appointed.  Court appoints Atty in 22CF148, asking to have Initial appearance on 10/14/22 at 10:00.  If def appears by zoom stipulation for identification.  22CF148 bond applying same bond in place in 22CF125.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

COVERS CASES: 22CF125 & 22CF148
Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons. 
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
Def to have NO Contact w/ H.G.
